businessProfile.name: BUZZO PIZZA
businessProfile.address: 2510 S Main St, Soquel, CA 95073, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 2510 S Main St, Soquel, CA 95073, USA

reviews.text:
As a family that truly loves Italian cuisine, we‚Äôve visited countless Italian restaurants in various regions. Buzzo Wood Fired Pizza immediately impressed us with its modern, stylish interior and its open kitchen ‚Äî a design choice that suggested both culinary transparency and a commitment to cleanliness. It set the stage for high expectations.

Yet, upon entering, there was an inexplicable sense of unease. It‚Äôs hard to pinpoint whether it stemmed from the service itself or the overall atmosphere, but the warmth and friendliness we often appreciate in a dining experience felt somewhat absent.

For our mains, we ordered The Charlie Pizza and The Jenkins Pizza. The Charlie Pizza was, unfortunately, far too salty. A touch of saltiness can enhance flavor, but in this case, it overpowered the dish and made it difficult to enjoy. The Jenkins Pizza, featuring jalape√±os for a bit of spice, was fine but lacked any particularly memorable or distinctive character.

The highlight of the meal, however, came in the form of the appetizer: Arancini. These crispy, golden risotto balls, served with a parmesan sauce and leek oil, were exceptional. The contrast of the crunchy exterior and creamy risotto center, paired with the rich and aromatic sauces, was superb ‚Äî easily redeeming the shortcomings of the pizzas we ordered.

In the end, Buzzo Wood Fired Pizza shows great potential, with a stylish setting and certain dishes that shine. A warmer, more welcoming service experience and better balance in the pizza seasoning could elevate it into a truly outstanding destination.

Really solid pizza. It was overall a great vibe, with a nice outdoor area. I had heard a lot of great things about Buzzo's before finally getting an opportunity to eat here, so was really hopeful. Definitely see why people like it! The crust is damn near perfect, and the arancini was wonderful.

The better pizza was definitely the margherita. I had heard a lot about the potato pizza, but to me it just didn't really seem to work; there were so many ingredients and it just didn't meld well to me.

Neither pizza had the marbling on the cheese I was hoping for, but definitely overall a really solid experience! Would come back for sure!

Waiter was excellent.  Atmosphere too.  Pizza was very spare with toppings. Crust was cooked, but only crisp on the outermost edge, otherwise unusually limp‚Ä¶almost wet. Caesar salad was gooey.  Rita choices‚Ä¶.ultra sweet but waiter brought extra lemon juice (nice).  Olives were good.  Meatballs very good.  So much room for improvement on this simple, but very hard-to-interpret menu.
And pretty pricey!

Huge delicious arugula salad with strawberries! Enough for 4! Service outstanding! Francisco our waiter very attentive! Good wine! Pizza Hot from the oven, so good! Our first time in this lovely garden setting! Will go back soon!

Nice, clean, ambient little restaurant.
The meatballs were 10/10. They toasted the bread perfectly to go with it and the ricotta added on top was soo delicious!
The arancini that people seemed to rage about wasn't really special to me personally. The filling was a bit bland and the sauce wasn't anything too crazy. Just your typical arancini.
For this place being a pizza place, the pizza that we received was a 6/10 for me. The crust was spectacular. Very soft yet chewy, it felt like a warm mochi. The flavor was overall good but I don't like my pizza wet.
The waitress was very sweet and nice. It was busy for a Thursday night. She came and checked up on us three times during their rush asking how everything is.
The ambiance and service got me enjoying my stay here.

recentReviews.text: Excellent service, delicious food, nice place. I loved it!

Waiter was excellent.  Atmosphere too.  Pizza was very spare with toppings. Crust was cooked, but only crisp on the outermost edge, otherwise unusually limp‚Ä¶almost wet. Caesar salad was gooey.  Rita choices‚Ä¶.ultra sweet but waiter brought extra lemon juice (nice).  Olives were good.  Meatballs very good.  So much room for improvement on this simple, but very hard-to-interpret menu.
And pretty pricey!

It set the stage for high expectations.

A touch of saltiness can enhance flavor, but in this case, it overpowered the dish and made it difficult to enjoy. The Jenkins Pizza, featuring jalape√±os for a bit of spice, was fine but lacked any particularly memorable or distinctive character.

The highlight of the meal, however, came in the form of the appetizer: Arancini. These crispy, golden risotto balls, served with a parmesan sauce and leek oil, were exceptional. The contrast of the crunchy exterior and creamy risotto center, paired with the rich and aromatic sauces, was superb ‚Äî easily redeeming the shortcomings of the pizzas we ordered.

In the end, Buzzo Wood Fired Pizza shows great potential, with a stylish setting and certain dishes that shine. A warmer, more welcoming service experience and better balance in the pizza seasoning could elevate it into a truly outstanding destination.
This place is amazing! Food is some of the best in the county! Can‚Äôt beat the pizza and the meatballs are incredible! Please never get rid of the salted caramel brownie Sunday!
We ate here recently. The food was great! Staff were friendly to us and the atmosphere is just amazing!

Huge delicious arugula salad with strawberries! Enough for 4! Service outstanding! Francisco our waiter very attentive! Good wine! Pizza Hot from the oven, so good! Our first time in this lovely garden setting! Will go back soon!

detailedReviews.author: Maria Agueda Zambrano
detailedReviews.text: Excellent service, delicious food, nice place. I loved it!

detailedReviews.author: marilyn hoyt
detailedReviews.text:
Waiter was excellent.  Atmosphere too.  Pizza was very spare with toppings. Crust was cooked, but only crisp on the outermost edge, otherwise unusually limp‚Ä¶almost wet. Caesar salad was gooey.  Rita choices‚Ä¶.ultra sweet but waiter brought extra lemon juice (nice).  Olives were good.  Meatballs very good.  So much room for improvement on this simple, but very hard-to-interpret menu.
And pretty pricey!

detailedReviews.author: Terry Sung
detailedReviews.text:
As a family that truly loves Italian cuisine, we‚Äôve visited countless Italian restaurants in various regions. Buzzo Wood Fired Pizza immediately impressed us with its modern, stylish interior and its open kitchen ‚Äî a design choice that suggested both culinary transparency and a commitment to cleanliness. It set the stage for high expectations.

Yet, upon entering, there was an inexplicable sense of unease. It‚Äôs hard to pinpoint whether it stemmed from the service itself or the overall atmosphere, but the warmth and friendliness we often appreciate in a dining experience felt somewhat absent.

For our mains, we ordered The Charlie Pizza and The Jenkins Pizza. The Charlie Pizza was, unfortunately, far too salty. A touch of saltiness can enhance flavor, but in this case, it overpowered the dish and made it difficult to enjoy. The Jenkins Pizza, featuring jalape√±os for a bit of spice, was fine but lacked any particularly memorable or distinctive character.

The highlight of the meal, however, came in the form of the appetizer: Arancini. These crispy, golden risotto balls, served with a parmesan sauce and leek oil, were exceptional. The contrast of the crunchy exterior and creamy risotto center, paired with the rich and aromatic sauces, was superb ‚Äî easily redeeming the shortcomings of the pizzas we ordered.

In the end, Buzzo Wood Fired Pizza shows great potential, with a stylish setting and certain dishes that shine. A warmer, more welcoming service experience and better balance in the pizza seasoning could elevate it into a truly outstanding destination.

detailedReviews.author: Philip Primeaux
detailedReviews.text: This place is amazing! Food is some of the best in the county! Can‚Äôt beat the pizza and the meatballs are incredible! Please never get rid of the salted caramel brownie Sunday!

detailedReviews.author: Loredo Group Realty
detailedReviews.text: We ate here recently. The food was great! Staff were friendly to us and the atmosphere is just amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Michele Swanberg
detailedReviews.text: Huge delicious arugula salad with strawberries! Enough for 4! Service outstanding! Francisco our waiter very attentive! Good wine! Pizza Hot from the oven, so good! Our first time in this lovely garden setting! Will go back soon!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Touchton
detailedReviews.text: Really great ambiance and reasonable price! Excellent mushroom pizza, nice truffle taste

detailedReviews.author: Julie Cooper
detailedReviews.text: One of the best meals I‚Äôve had in a long time. We got the Caesar salad, meatballs, and pepperoni pizza. Everything was amazing. The service was also a 5/5. Will definitely be returning next time I am in the area.

detailedReviews.author: Stuart Fullmer
detailedReviews.text: I grabbed for take out and enjoyed a beer while I waited. For some reason the card reader was acting up but the hostess preserved. The pizza was great and the arincini delightful.

detailedReviews.author: Marc Rigo
detailedReviews.text: The best pizza in Santa Cruz Great service

detailedReviews.author: Mike Delorme
detailedReviews.text:
Recent visited - first and only time there. The atmosphere wasn't particularly nice, but that may be because we were seated at what's probably the worst seat in the house - right next to the entry way at the bar, right next to the bathrooms, and right next to the access way to the kitchen/behind the bar.
The pizza was good - the crust was nice and chewy, but if you're not into white sauce or pineapple the selection becomes somewhat limited. I had the Nduja, which was good. The vegetarian person in my party had the Margherita since it's the only red sauce vegetarian pizza without pineapple - it was okay, but we've had much better elsewhere.

detailedReviews.author: Jake Byman
detailedReviews.text:
Really solid pizza. It was overall a great vibe, with a nice outdoor area. I had heard a lot of great things about Buzzo's before finally getting an opportunity to eat here, so was really hopeful. Definitely see why people like it! The crust is damn near perfect, and the arancini was wonderful.

The better pizza was definitely the margherita. I had heard a lot about the potato pizza, but to me it just didn't really seem to work; there were so many ingredients and it just didn't meld well to me.

Neither pizza had the marbling on the cheese I was hoping for, but definitely overall a really solid experience! Would come back for sure!

detailedReviews.author: Dylan Moriarty
detailedReviews.text: The pepperoni pizza followed by a brownie and gelato was one of the best meals we‚Äôve had in the area!

detailedReviews.author: Mitch Carnes
detailedReviews.text: Food is excellent! Service staff is new'ish but attentive. Value is excellent. I'll be back!

detailedReviews.author: Tyler Thomas
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was great! Very fresh. We also had the meatballs and they were amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Dave Martone (DMarty454)
detailedReviews.text: Food was great.  Clean, friendly service, reasonably priced.  Highly recommend üëå.

detailedReviews.author: Margaret Salazar
detailedReviews.text: Let me start with the toppings were fresh and tasty albeit honestly to much due to fact I ordered multiple toppings. The dough was fresh However it tasted like charcoal from oven being to hot. Went early as well before they we're busy,very disappointing

detailedReviews.author: Jenny Varela
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely delicious. Enjoyed my dinner and dessert!

detailedReviews.author: Dave Mitchell
detailedReviews.text:
Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Wood fired, classic thin, crispy crust...made and served by super friendly staff. We had a salad on the side which was also delicious and the gelato was the perfect dessert.  Though we didn't have any apps, they looked tasty! Just go. You won't be disappointed...

Update: Just had the Carbonara - the taste of the crust is exceptional and the topping ratio was perfect and delicious (leftovers made for an excellent breakfast topped with arugula and a poached edd üòã).  We also had the crispy cauliflower which was super yummy. Honestly- this might be the best value in Santa Cruz.

detailedReviews.author: Matteus Olmedo
detailedReviews.text: Fave pizza joint in Santa Cruz area. Service, quality, atmosphere - this has it all

detailedReviews.author: Galina Merz
detailedReviews.text: Superb pizza, crispy cauliflower, and meatballs in tomato sauce.

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth Woll
detailedReviews.text: THE BEST! I‚Äôve been to Buzzo 4 times at this point because their pizza is the best in Santa Cruz (in my opinion as a New Englander). The atmosphere is lively but also somehow relaxed and the side salads are GREAT too. Also I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôve gone into debt when I‚Äôve gone which keeps us coming back.

detailedReviews.author: Laisha CR
detailedReviews.text: Excellent place üëå

detailedReviews.author: John Pierce
detailedReviews.text: Excellent oak fired Italian style pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Tyler Phillips
detailedReviews.text:
Buzzo exceeded our expectations! The atmosphere was inviting and cozy. The service was attentive and professional. And the food was absolutely terrific.
We got a celery pear fennel salad that was crisp, fresh, flavorful, and perfect. We also ordered the squash delicatta pizza, and we were impressed. The wood-fired crust had just the right amount of chew, while staying perfectly soft inside and having excellent flavor. The sauce, squash, and bacon added richness and layers of flavor and individuality. Overall, this food was made with the highest quality and most flavorful ingredients, and an attention to detail that made the entire dining experience a pleasure. I highly recommend Buzzo Pizza; you will be happy you chose to visit.

detailedReviews.author: Jesse Mendez
detailedReviews.text:
Pizza is excellent here! Pasta and Caesar salad were big enough portions to share and were equally delicious!
When checking out the pizza oven, I noticed the food prep area was as large as the dining room. The chefs gotta love cooking in this kitchen! It was designed by the owner, and all I can say is I was impressed and I will be back.

detailedReviews.author: Jesse Dyer
detailedReviews.text: Our first time at Buzzo was long over due, but it was worth the wait! We brought our 14 month old along with friends and their 16 month old and everyone including the kids loved the food and the vibes. The staff was accommodating, friendly and efficient and the food was absolutely delicious. We will be back soon!

detailedReviews.author: Mayor Of Hawaii
detailedReviews.text:
My name is Keleanu from San Francisco. We stayed here in capitola for the weekend and Buzzo Pizza was highly recommended.
We ordered the sausage and mushrooms pizza and it was delicious. Even our Chinese grandma from Kunming China loved the pizza here! Thanks for the delicious memories here in Capitola California!

detailedReviews.author: Casimir Dowd
detailedReviews.text: Great food, excellent variety, cool but casual atmosphere, prices for the food are excellent.  One of the top spots in Santa Cruz!

detailedReviews.author: Jack Hanson
detailedReviews.text: This is a wonderful pizza place with a unique menu. The potato pizza is actually quite good! I have never heard of that before coming here. Their Mushroom pizza is very good. Their artichoke hearts are also phenomenal. Their pizza is cooked in a wood fired oven from what I can tell and the crust is thin and crispy. Their Caesar salad is great as well. I was very happy with the food they served my family and I.

detailedReviews.author: Chris Hanson
detailedReviews.text: Again, I hate to give this bunch of stars because I don't want it to be a crowded. Good pizza. Good atmosphere. Good service.

detailedReviews.author: Beck Orion
detailedReviews.text: Super nice little pizza place after a long road trip. The service was fast and friendly, and the food was outstanding! I really enjoyed the special pizza with squash and a white sauce. I wish there was more than one pasta option, though. The patio is dog very dog friendly, and was nice except for the fact that the table was a little wobbly.

detailedReviews.author: Patrick Vuscan
detailedReviews.text: Got two delicious pizzas, the burrata appetizer, and drinks! They‚Äôve got a nice atmosphere/look, and our waiter Francisco was wonderful. Will come back :)

detailedReviews.author: Einna Seira
detailedReviews.text:
Nice, clean, ambient little restaurant.
The meatballs were 10/10. They toasted the bread perfectly to go with it and the ricotta added on top was soo delicious!
The arancini that people seemed to rage about wasn't really special to me personally. The filling was a bit bland and the sauce wasn't anything too crazy. Just your typical arancini.
For this place being a pizza place, the pizza that we received was a 6/10 for me. The crust was spectacular. Very soft yet chewy, it felt like a warm mochi. The flavor was overall good but I don't like my pizza wet.
The waitress was very sweet and nice. It was busy for a Thursday night. She came and checked up on us three times during their rush asking how everything is.
The ambiance and service got me enjoying my stay here.

detailedReviews.author: Rolo Mejia
detailedReviews.text: This is our go to spot whenever we‚Äôre in the area. Every pizza we‚Äôve had has been delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Reed Welch
detailedReviews.text:
When the crispy cauliflower appetizer and the bourbon cake deserts are the highlight of the dining experience, it doesn‚Äôt say much for the pizza. I am a fan of thin crust pizza, but sadly the crust on our pizza was just too soggy, with the toppings sliding off. Have to admit that the pesto sauce and the mushroom toppings were tasty, if only they were on a nicer crust.
Also, our tab had an unexpected service charge, with no explanation.
It will be a while before we return, since there are many other options in the area.

detailedReviews.author: C Insight
detailedReviews.text: The five of us went there on a busy Saturday,  July 20 for dinner.  We loved the appetizers best.  We had crispy vegetables, which we fried cauliflower, the burrito cheese, and the Caesar salad. All of them were surprisingly delicious with very distinct flavors.  Then we had the mushroom pizza and the pepperoni pizza which were ok but did not compare to the appetizers.  They only had ales and one pilsner as beer. Unfortunately no lager.  We had one ale and one pilsner which were ok but not great. Our waitress, Julia, was very friendly and did a wonderful job.  We will be back but more for the appetizers than the pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Jeremy Kamil
detailedReviews.text: Highly recommend

detailedReviews.author: J. T.
detailedReviews.text: The Jenkins spicy pizza with the delicious brownie dessert after was absolutely amazing! We will 100% drive back here anytime we are in the Santa Cruz area!

detailedReviews.author: JS YU
detailedReviews.text: ÏÜåÏø†ÏóòÎ°úÏª¨ ÌôîÎçïÌîºÏûêÎßõÏßë. ÎèÑÏö∞ÎèÑ Îã¥Î∞±ÌïòÍ≥† ÎäêÌÉÄÎ¶¨Î≤ÑÏÑØÏùÄ ÎÑàÎ¨¥ Ï´ÑÍπÉÌïòÍ≥† ÎßõÏûàÏùå. ÌïúÍµ≠ÏÇ¨Îûå ÏûÖÎßõÏóê good~~~ Ï†ÅÍ∑π Ï∂îÏ≤úÌï®.

detailedReviews.author: Doug Stotland
detailedReviews.text:
Out go to pizza experience on the east side.  Surprisingly easy to get a table probably cause a lot of the pizza gets eaten in beer 30.  Appetizers are pretty awesome too.  The potato pizza is an all timer.  The pepperoni is delicious and surpisingly interesting .

Also fun to sit at the high table near the oven and watch the crew toss, assemble and bake the pies.

Expensive but worth it.

detailedReviews.author: Ellen Solway
detailedReviews.text: Went today before the restaurant opened and the staff was so gracious, bringing out menus and water for me and my friend.  I can't eat tomatoes, so it was great to see so many alternative pizza options and interesting salads on the menu. We ordered ice cold tap IPAs and the Gorgonzola pizza with cheese, dates, caramelized onion and more. Delicious! The service was attentive and friendly. It was a hot day so we sat in the spacious outdoor seating area. I was very pleased with the experience and the meal and can't wait to go back and try more from the menu!

detailedReviews.author: Noel Noguez
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in town!

detailedReviews.author: Andrea Todd
detailedReviews.text: Vanilla Bourbon cake with homemade vanilla ice cream, toffee nuts  and marshmallow puffs üòã

detailedReviews.author: Justi Dieh
detailedReviews.text: I called three times tonight and it rang off the hook. The website does not have specialty pizza ingredient list or descriptions. I will try to taste the food again when I‚Äôm back in town.

detailedReviews.author: George Zaferes
detailedReviews.text:
Every item is simple,but, FLAVORFUL,
NOT really pricey, by 2024 standards.
Who else makes arancini? No one.
Burrata ü§Ø pizza The Charlie..fresh, perfecto! Thank you for this hidden gem behind Sunnyside Produce and Beer Thirty. Didn't try dessert...next time

detailedReviews.author: Sumati B
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is tasty but their salads are really fantastic!!

detailedReviews.author: Annie Youmans
detailedReviews.text: Buzzo has, by far, the best pizza in the area. I'm in love with the Truffle Mushroom and the Gorgonzola, Date, Caramelized Onion pizzas (those aren't the names, but they'll know which ones you mean). Either call the order in, or stop in first before going next door to Beer Thirty. They'll text you when it's ready. You can take it home or bring it back over to BT and have another pint. :) The people that work at Buzzo are friendly and the service is fantastic (don't forget to tip them). They have a lovely patio, if you'd like to dine in and enjoy other tasty morsels off the menu. Go there! Cheers!

detailedReviews.author: Lisa Fioretti
detailedReviews.text: Buzzo has become a staple in our take out/dine out rotation. The carbonara is my absolute favorite, highly recommend this spot!

detailedReviews.author: Graham Hine
detailedReviews.text: Tried the Charlie pizza and burrata appetizer. The pizza is excellent - best I've found in the area.  The crust is crispy and airy but tender inside.  Sauce is simple and good and the toppings are top quality. The burrata is served with oven dried tomatoes and fry bread, and is just outstanding. Nice job!

detailedReviews.author: Dillon Horst
detailedReviews.text: quite seriously the best pizza in town, maybe the best pizza ever. would have taken a photo but didn‚Äôt we realize what was happening till it was too late. Wow

detailedReviews.author: Charlie O'Loughlin
detailedReviews.text: Excellent pizza! The chicken wings were a great special, and the apps were fantastic. Especially the carrots. Service was super friendly and attentive, and the vibe was fun with low pretence. Great experience all round.

detailedReviews.author: Tim Bennett
detailedReviews.text: We were blown away by the amazing food, service and atmosphere at Buzzo!  We had the burrata and crispy cauliflower apps, and three pizzas!  All were fantastic!  Pizza crust is the perfect amount of crispy perfection! Great unique pizza flavors and traditional alike! Our server, Ellenore, was attentive, knowledgeable and provided great service!  We can‚Äôt wait to dine here again soon!

detailedReviews.author: Andrew Sutton
detailedReviews.text: Amazing wood fired pizza joint in Soquel! Glad we finally tried this joint after typically driving across town to either Mentone or Bantam. My wife and I had the burrata with bread and the arancini for apps before enjoying the pepperoni pizza and zucchini pepperoni as we couldn‚Äôt settle on just one pizza. Glad we got both as both were super yummy, and we had leftovers to take home. Sitting inside was a good time as we could easily see the pizza being made and cooked, which just enhanced our time there. Great staff, too!

detailedReviews.author: Stephany Buswell
detailedReviews.text: Awesome pizza! The best.

detailedReviews.author: Marge Pezzola
detailedReviews.text:
We had the pepperoni pizza and it was delicious‚Ä¶ we also had the Ceasar
salad and the meatballs and I would order again and again.  Julia  was our server and she was prompt, friendly and cared about our dining experience. Noah  was also a delight with a great sense of humor and attended to our needs. We will be back!

detailedReviews.author: Kim Hardin
detailedReviews.text:
The best adult pizza date in the county!
Also beautiful atrium room for groups!
Twice We‚Äôve had groups of 10, service and food outstanding. We love 1/2 wine Tuesdays.

detailedReviews.author: Russ Bianchi
detailedReviews.text: Consistentl top notch

detailedReviews.author: Ted Cocoles
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in the 831.

detailedReviews.author: Anthony Bendana
detailedReviews.text:
Great PIZZA and meatballs and Cesar salad followed by GREAT customer service EVERYTIME.
Definitely our go to here in Santa Cruz. Don‚Äôt sleep on this gem.

detailedReviews.author: Caitlin Fahey
detailedReviews.text: Delicious pizza, appetizers, wine and desserts. This place is a gem! Service and ambiance is excellent. One of my favorite restaurants in the county. My kids are in love with the potato pizza and meatballs üòçüçï

detailedReviews.author: M Topp
detailedReviews.text: My families weekly go to spot. We love the pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Theodore Fletcher
detailedReviews.text: This place was good for the Cesar salad and pizza we had. It is a small place so keep that in mind but  will go back for the pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Jeff Schuster
detailedReviews.text: Good pizza, but can only order from the small number of selections on the menu, no additions or substitutions allowed.   The wait staff is young and inexperienced.

detailedReviews.author: Maritina Rodriguez
detailedReviews.text: great app (esp the meatballs) and pizza with excellent service and good price point. our favorite pizza spot!

detailedReviews.author: Tammy Lee
detailedReviews.text: The arugula salad and the margherita pizza was the best we‚Äôve ever had. The atmosphere was so wonderful, and our service was good. They seemed to be short staffed with servers, but we were just enjoying a relaxing evening. The browned butter gelato was the perfect finish. We will be back for sure!

detailedReviews.author: Jaime Acosta
detailedReviews.text: Great food! Pepperoni pizza is my fav. But the charlie pizza is pretty good too. Wine options aren't too bad either.

detailedReviews.author: Don Christian
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza and appetizers, the Caesar salad was delicious

detailedReviews.author: kendall jameson
detailedReviews.text: I recently dined at Buzzo and unfortunately, the service left much to be desired. Our food was served considerably late, and to make matters worse, our order was forgotten. The waiter seemed overwhelmed, leading to a frustrating dining experience. I hope the management takes steps to improve their service and avoid such issues in the future.

detailedReviews.author: JEANETTE ARAMBURU
detailedReviews.text: The mushroom truffle pizza is to die for.

detailedReviews.author: Pamela Wagner
detailedReviews.text:
We tried Buzzo on the recommendation of a friend, and we'll definitely be back! We hadn't made reservations,  so sat outside under what looked like heat lamps, although they're hanging too high to provide any warmth ( we'll be eating inside next trip!)
The beet,avocado salad was delicious! Just the perfect flavor combination.  We also had the fried green beans which were done perfectly, the batter light and expertly fried.
The margherita pizza was one of the best I've had, locally for sure; great crust, just the right amount of sauce and excellent quality mozzarella.
We'll be making reservations and heading back soon!

detailedReviews.author: Heidi Petruzzi
detailedReviews.text: What a great place all together! Food was amazing - my husband is Italian and he‚Äôs very particular about his pizza. He loved the appetizers, pizzas, and dessert we ordered and that‚Äôs a big deal! The mushroom truffle pizza is out of this world delicious. We are definitely going back!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.8/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: The arancini appetizer, with its crispy exterior and creamy risotto center, paired with rich parmesan sauce and leek oil, is exceptional and a standout dish. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The stylish and modern interior with an open kitchen design creates a visually appealing dining experience that emphasizes culinary transparency and cleanliness. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The outdoor garden setting provides a lovely ambiance, enhancing the dining experience and encouraging repeat visits. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Lack of warmth and friendliness in service - social media marketing can improve this area
Inconsistent pizza quality (e.g., soggy crust, overly salty) - review management can address this concern
Poor online information (e.g., missing specialty pizza descriptions) - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

positive.author: Maria Agueda Zambrano
positive.text: Excellent service, delicious food, nice place. I loved it!

neutral.author: Mike Delorme
neutral.text:
Recent visited - first and only time there. The atmosphere wasn't particularly nice, but that may be because we were seated at what's probably the worst seat in the house - right next to the entry way at the bar, right next to the bathrooms, and right next to the access way to the kitchen/behind the bar.
The pizza was good - the crust was nice and chewy, but if you're not into white sauce or pineapple the selection becomes somewhat limited. I had the Nduja, which was good. The vegetarian person in my party had the Margherita since it's the only red sauce vegetarian pizza without pineapple - it was okay, but we've had much better elsewhere.

neutral.author: Margaret Salazar
neutral.text: Let me start with the toppings were fresh and tasty albeit honestly to much due to fact I ordered multiple toppings. The dough was fresh However it tasted like charcoal from oven being to hot. Went early as well before they we're busy,very disappointing

neutral.author: Reed Welch
neutral.text:
When the crispy cauliflower appetizer and the bourbon cake deserts are the highlight of the dining experience, it doesn‚Äôt say much for the pizza. I am a fan of thin crust pizza, but sadly the crust on our pizza was just too soggy, with the toppings sliding off. Have to admit that the pesto sauce and the mushroom toppings were tasty, if only they were on a nicer crust.
Also, our tab had an unexpected service charge, with no explanation.
It will be a while before we return, since there are many other options in the area.

negative.author: marilyn hoyt
negative.text:
Waiter was excellent.  Atmosphere too.  Pizza was very spare with toppings. Crust was cooked, but only crisp on the outermost edge, otherwise unusually limp‚Ä¶almost wet. Caesar salad was gooey.  Rita choices‚Ä¶.ultra sweet but waiter brought extra lemon juice (nice).  Olives were good.  Meatballs very good.  So much room for improvement on this simple, but very hard-to-interpret menu.
And pretty pricey!

negative.author: Justi Dieh
negative.text: I called three times tonight and it rang off the hook. The website does not have specialty pizza ingredient list or descriptions. I will try to taste the food again when I‚Äôm back in town.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
